channel.title: KNIGHTS OF THE GOLDEN CIRCLE
channel.description: Was Jesse James killed in Saint Joseph Missouri? Or did he live on to a ripe old age of 101. Did Jesse bury gold/treasure? What is the truth about the most publicized Outlaw in the history of the OLD WEST
channel.itunes:subtitle: Jesse James-murder-old west tales
channel.itunes:author: J James
channel.itunes:summary: Was Jesse James killed in Saint Joseph Missouri? Or did he live on to a ripe old age of 101. Did Jesse bury gold/treasure? What is the truth about the most publicized Outlaw in the history of the OLD WEST

item.title: Death Valley Days tells the story of OUTLAW SAM BASS
item.description: OUTLAW Sam Bass started out an honest man. After running away from the abusive uncle who raised him, he went to work in a sawmill in Mississippi. His dream was to be a cowboy and he eventually made his way to Texas. After one season, he decided he didn’t like it. In 1876, Bass and a rough character named Joel Collins drove a herd of longhorns up north where the prices for cattle were higher. They were supposed to go back to Texas to pay off the owners of the herd, but instead they took the $8,000 profit for themselves. He and Collins wasted the money from the cattle drive on gambling in Deadwood. A few months later, he and Collins went into another venture- stagecoach robbery. After holding up seven stagecoaches, they didn’t make much money. They set their sights on bigger prizes and turned to train robbery. Bass and his gang robbed the Union Pacific gold train from San Francisco, netting over $60,000, which is to this day the largest single robbery of the Union Pacific. He was wounded by Texas Rangers on the way to rob a small bank in Round Rock, and died two days later on his 27th birthday.
item.dc:creator: J James
item.itunes:summary:
OUTLAW Sam Bass started out an honest man. After running away from the abusive uncle who raised him, he went to work in a sawmill in Mississippi.
His dream was to be a cowboy and he eventually made his way to Texas. After one season, he decided he didn’t like it. In 1876, Bass and a rough character named Joel Collins drove a herd of longhorns up north where the prices for cattle were higher.
They were supposed to go back to Texas to pay off the owners of the herd, but instead they took the $8,000 profit for themselves. He and Collins wasted the money from the cattle drive on gambling in Deadwood.
A few months later, he and Collins went into another venture- stagecoach robbery. After holding up seven stagecoaches, they didn’t make much money. They set their sights on bigger prizes and turned to train robbery.
Bass and his gang robbed the Union Pacific gold train from San Francisco, netting over $60,000, which is to this day the largest single robbery of the Union Pacific. He was wounded by Texas Rangers on the way to rob a small bank in Round Rock, and died two days later on his 27th birthday.

item.title: Knights of the Golden Circle-Outlaw Jesse James Grandson interview series-INTERVIEW #2
item.description: JESSE JAMES MOTHER DNA PROVES that Mr Simmons is grandson of Jesse James Mr Simmons reveals more interesting information about his grandfather JESSE JAMES Some very interesting stories about Jesse James Treasure Hideouts Alias The James Gang and its members BOOK WRITTEN BY MR SIMMONS

item.title: Knights of the Golden Circle Inteview #3 with Grandson of Outlaw Jesse James
item.description: Very interesting interview,with grandson of Jesse James, some new information is revealed. New stories about Jesse James and buried treasure. Mr Simmons reveals new information on his grandfather Jesse James. A must hear interview for all that are interested in the story of Jesse James. Interview was conducted in Saint Joseph Missouri town where Jesse James was supposed to have been murdered SAINT JOSEPH MISSOURI HOME OF JESSE JAMES WHERE HE WAS SUPPOSED TO HAVE BEEN MURDERED -SHOT IN THE BACK OF THE HEAD
item.dc:creator: J James
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: Knights of the Golden Circle-Interview with great grandson of Old West Outlaw Jesse James
item.description: Interview with GREAT GRANDSON of OUTLAW JESSE JAMES Interview was conducted in Saint Joseph Missouri Some information revealed for the first time Straight forward talk about his grandfather Outlaw Jesse James,who died at the ripe old age of 101
item.dc:creator: J James
